page.title: 16The St.Albans carnival.
page.content: There has been a{carnival}in St. Albans,on and off,{since 1939.}It was revived in{1971}for the{Queen's Silver {Jubilee.}It was a great success and expanded and has now become an annual event. It is now the{second largest} carnival{in the country.}There is a{procession}from Bernards Heath to Westminster Lodge,of over 100 floats. The{Morris dancers}and the{City band perform outside the Town hall.There is a{funfair}and{140 market stalls}are set up at Westminster Lodge.There is also an{arena show.}This year there will be a{Spitfire}and a {Hurricane } aeroplane,{R.A.F. parachutists}and an{ {army band. { Proceeds}go to{local charities.}The {Round table}organises the carnival with the backing of the{council. Benefiting charities also help.
